text:
I am getting the error `syntax: too few type parameters specified in "new{...}" around …`, so I looked it up but the solution I found <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-to-resolve-syntax-too-few-type-parameters-specified-in-new/15766|here> doesn’t work.  This is the struct I am trying to make:
```mutable struct Word{N, T} <: AbstractWord{N, T}
    w::MVector{N, T}
    
    Word(w::NTuple{N, T}) where {N, T} = new{typeof(w)}(MVector{N, T}(w))
    Word(w::AbstractVector{T}) where {T} = new{typeof(w)}(MVector{length(w), T}(w))
end```
Does anyone know why I am still getting the error?

elements.text: syntax: too few type parameters specified in "new{...}" around …
, so I looked it up but the solution I found
doesn’t work.  This is the struct I am trying to make:
Does anyone know why I am still getting the error?

text: Word expects two types N and T but you only provide one with typeof(w)

elements.text: Word expects two types N and T but you only provide one with typeof(w)

text: Ahh, I see.  The answer makes more sense now…  Thank you Théo :slightly_smiling_face:
